bibl.title: filotim€a in Byzantine Papyrus Documents. <philotimia>
bibl.note: In sixth-century financial documents, filotim€a means a fund of staple commodities or of money, out of which disbursements were made to professionals or craftsmen as honoraria for services rendered. <philotimia>
MacCOULL Leslie S.B., filotim€a in Byzantine Papyrus Documents. <philotimia>
